1.text: Therefore, holy brothers, partakers of a heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our confession, Jesus;

2.text: who was faithful to him who appointed him, as also was Moses in all his house.

3.text: For he has been counted worthy of more glory than Moses, inasmuch as he who built the house has more honor than the house.

4.text: For every house is built by someone; but he who built all things is God.

5.text: Moses indeed was faithful in all his house as a servant, for a testimony of those things which were afterward to be spoken,

6.text: but Christ is faithful as a Son over his house; whose house we are, if we hold fast our confidence and the glorying of our hope firm to the end.

7.text: Therefore, even as the Holy Spirit says, “Today if you will hear his voice,

8.text: don’t harden your hearts, as in the rebellion, like as in the day of the trial in the wilderness,

9.text: where your fathers tested me by proving me, and saw my works for forty years.

10.text: Therefore I was displeased with that generation, and said, ‘They always err in their heart, but they didn’t know my ways;’

11.text: as I swore in my wrath, ‘They will not enter into my rest.’”

12.text: Beware, brothers, lest perhaps there be in any one of you an evil heart of unbelief, in falling away from the living God;

13.text: but exhort one another day by day, so long as it is called “today;” lest any one of you be hardened by the deceitfulness of sin.

14.text: For we have become partakers of Christ, if we hold fast the beginning of our confidence firm to the end:

15.text: while it is said, “Today if you will hear his voice, don’t harden your hearts, as in the rebellion.”

16.text: For who, when they heard, rebelled? No, didn’t all those who came out of Egypt by Moses?

17.text: With whom was he displeased forty years? Wasn’t it with those who sinned, whose bodies fell in the wilderness?

18.text: To whom did he swear that they wouldn’t enter into his rest, but to those who were disobedient?

19.text: We see that they were not able to enter in because of unbelief.
